trans-unit.source: Represents the content of a SOAP header.
A message header contains optional metadata that describe a message encapsulated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> class.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> can have zero or more headers that are used as an extension mechanism to pass information in messages that are application-specific.
You can use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.Headers%2A> to add message headers to a message by calling the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders.Add%2A> method.
[!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] provides a number of predefined message headers, as shown in the following table.
Header Name
Description
To
Contains the role that the message is targeting.
Action
Provides a description of how the message should be processed.
FaultTo
Contains the address of the node to which faults should be sent.
From
Contains the address of the node that sent the message.
Request
Indicates whether the message is a request.
MessageID
Contains the unique ID of the message.
RelatesTo
Contains the IDs of messages that are related to this message.
ReplyTo
Contains the address of the node to which a reply should be sent for a request.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the targeted recipient of the message header.
If this property is empty, the header is interpreted as targeted for the ultimate recipient of the message.
The targeted recipient of the message header.
The default is an empty string ("").
Creates a new message header with the specified data.
The local name of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The content of the header to be created.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.
Creates a new message header with the specified data.
The local name of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The content of the header to be created.
A value that indicates whether the header must be understood.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.
Creates a header from an object to be serialized using the XmlFormatter.
The local name of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The content of the header to be created.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.
Creates a new message header with the specified data.
The local name of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The content of the header to be created.
A value that indicates whether the header must be understood.
The targeted recipient of the message header.

A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.

The local name of the header XML element.

A value that indicates whether the header should be relayed.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.

The local name of the header XML element.

The content of the header to be created.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
A value that indicates whether the header must be understood.
The targeted recipient of the message header.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.
Creates a new message header with the specified data.
The local name of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The content of the header to be created.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
A value that indicates whether the header must be understood.
The targeted recipient of the message header.
A value that indicates whether the header should be relayed.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> object with the specified data.
Verifies whether the specified message version is supported.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
`true` if the specified message version is supported; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that specifies whether this message header contains reference parameters of an endpoint reference.
A reference parameter corresponds to the <`ReferenceParameters`> element described in the in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96163).
`true` if this message header contains reference parameters of an endpoint reference; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the header must be understood, according to SOAP 1.1/1.2 specification.
If this property is `true` and the message receiver cannot interpret the message header, the message is not processed and an exception is thrown.
If this property is `false`, the receiver can ignore the message header and continue processing.
`true` if the header must be understood; otherwise, `false`.
Called when the header content is serialized using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header contents.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
Called when the start header is serialized using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the start header.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
Gets a value that indicates whether the header should be relayed.
According to SOAP 1.1 spec, this value is always `false`.
`true` if the header should be relayed; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the string representation of this message header.
The string representation of this message header.
Serializes the header using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
Serializes the header using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
Serializes the header attributes using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header attributes.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
Serializes the header contents using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header contents.
The object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
Serializes the start header using the specified XML writer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the start header.
That object that contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
